meanings.definition: Slender or graceful in figure or outline.
meanings.sent1: The ballerina had a svelte figure that moved gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent2: She always admired how svelte and elegant her cat looked while grooming itself.
meanings.sent3: The svelte tree branches swayed gently in the breeze, looking almost like dancers.
meanings.sent4: Her svelte fingers moved swiftly across the piano keys, creating a melodious tune.
meanings.sent5: The svelte silhouette of the sailboat glided effortlessly across the calm waters.

meanings.definition: Trim, neat, or smart in appearance.
meanings.sent1: His svelte suit made him look sharp and professional at the business meeting.
meanings.sent2: The new car had a svelte design that caught the attention of many passersby.
meanings.sent3: The svelte arrangement of flowers on the table added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The chef's svelte presentation of the dish made it almost too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent5: The svelte lines of the building's architecture gave it a modern and sleek look.

meanings.sent1: The model walked down the runway with a svelte grace that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The swan glided across the lake, its svelte neck arched in a beautiful curve.
meanings.sent3: The svelte design of the phone made it not only functional but also stylish.
meanings.sent4: Her svelte movements on the dance floor were like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The svelte lines of the sculpture gave it an air of sophistication and refinement.
